inn1.comm: uppish and loose pushed drive, in the air but into space, third man fields
wide of off stump, plenty of swing, aided by a stiff breeze, and de Villiers leaves
again that swung into the right-hander, de Villiers into line and drops into the leg side
a similar line, de Villiers pushes the ball no more than five or six yards into the leg side
outside off and wide enough to leave
de Villiers pushes forward, a thick edge shoots along the ground to the right of solitary slip and the ball flies across the outfield
Smith whips that from middle-and-leg into the on side, an easy run to the man in the deep
that started wide of off and swung significantly, an easy wide to call and Gilchrist had to scurry across to gather
better line, and less swing, de Villiers leaves it alone
off-stump line, no movement, and de Villiers plays a solid forward defensive stroke and calls loudly and clearly "no"
massive shout as de Villiers took a half stride and misses. Aleem Dar shakes his head
outside off and no alarms this time as the batsman leaves it
McGrath finds the edge and it drops just short of Ponting at second slip
Smith takes a stroll down the pitch before Bracken is even in his delivery stride, prods and misses
this time Smith stays anchored to the crease and pushes into the covers
Smith again walks down the pitch to meet the ball, shapes to hit over the top and a sniff of swing takes the ball past the bat and into the off stump
Kallis spars and misses one outside off, much oohing and aahing among players, crowd and Cricinfo staff. 79mph for speed freaks.
wider, and Kallis able to watch that pass
82mph, and Kallis plays a slightly hurried defensive jab
wide and left
McGrath continues with his nagging line fractionally outside off - 79mph - and de Villiers not tempted to nibble ... yet
fractionally too wide, and McGrath looks to the heavens as he knows that's not quite the right line
quicker - 83mph - and de Villiers drawn forward and then leaves with a theatrical flourish
pushed defensive shot, a thick inside edge and the ball dribbles into the leg side
on target, de Villiers into line and plays into the leg side
punched off the back foot into the covers, and all with one hand as the bottom one slips off the handle as he plays the stroke
a strangled appeal as the ball hits Kallis high on the pad ... he had taken two big steps down the pitch
a rather limp drive between cover fielders, muted cheers and a solitary horn welcome the run to the man in the deep
a grunt from Bracken, and then a delivery wide off off stump which de Villiers leaves
de Villiers back, into line, and blocks into the off
another good over ends with a leave from de Villiers
Kallis not remotely tempted as the ball passes by and Gilchrist takes by his feet
Kallis dances down the track, McGrath sees him step to leg, follows him, but Kallis still punches that past extra cover
Kallis again gives himself room and advances to meet the ball, but McGrath fires in a yorker which clatters into the off stump
84mph from McGrath. Either the old man is fired up or, as has happened a few times, the speed gun is up the creek. Anyhow, outside off and Gibbs watches and leaves
half-volley outside off, driven to Hogg at mid-off and they scurry through for a quick single
McGrath drops short, de Villiers on it in a flash and smashes that past a diving short midwicket. That was really clobbered
wide and a slashed drive races to deep backward point
pushed to mid-on, Watson picks up and throws at the bowler's end, de Villiers was out had the ball hit. At 18 for 2, that was just daft
left alone
Gibbs shapes to flick to leg, gets a thick edge via pad, and the ball plops into the on side
de Villiers happy to leave one a foot outside the off
driven firmly to the left of mid-off, and that placement allows for the easy single
McGrath starts his fourth over with a loosener outside off
slightly closer to the off stump but again the batsman not lured into anything
pushed into the off side, pounced on like a fly in a Venus thingytrap
Glichrist takes that as de Villiers ushers it by
stock McGrath delivery, niggly and just outside off
de Villiers leaps out of his crease to meet the ball and square drives to the sweeper
Tait opens with a bouncer at 88mph, and it's almost as if de Villiers has been sent advanced notice, he's on it so fast and hammers that over midwicket
fired in at almost 93mph and de Villiers blocks off the back foot
slower ball - 91.9mph - and de Villiers is almost early on the attempted pull. It did keep low outside off ...
short - another 90mph+ delivery - and de Villiers sways back just in case
full, de Villiers drives with no foot movement, and a thick kick carries straight to Gilchrist. A fourth delivery over 90mph, a good mixture of length, and now South Africa are up against it
right back and drops the ball at his feet
McGrath seems almost a spinner after watching Tait ... good line, good length and defended
Gibbs thrusts his pad down the pitch, covering any movement, and then opts to leave
McGrath drifts to leg - seriously - and Gibbs turns the ball just in front of square
And that might be it ... about the worst ball McGrath has bowled, wide and angled away from the left-hander, but Prince slashes, gets a thin edge, and Gilchrist does the rest
McGrath on a hat-trick ... much better ball, a stock McGrath delivery, Boucher plays a nothing prod and the ball is held low down by Matthew Hayden at first slip
oh my goodness ... Kemp leaves and the ball passes knee-shakingly close to his off stump. Good judgment ... but a great over from McGrath.
and another! But Bucknor doesn't raise his finger. A fierce inswinger as Gibbs goes right back, inside edges it to Gilchrist who tumbles to his left but...Bucknor refuses to raise his finger
and he crashes this on the front foot but it's just wide of the lone slip - and I reiterate, there's just one slip in there
fabulous shot. The most textbook of cover drives, creaming it on the front foot through extra cover
ooh well bowled, Tait, cutting this back into Gibbs who is back into his crease - rather late on it - defending off the back foot
shorter this time from Tait, and he grunts in doing so, forcing Gibbs back into his crease and he defends off the back foot
very well bowled from Tait, who has so far been far from the scattergun. In fact, he's been sniper-like: a 93.4mph (150ish kph) inswinger which Gibbs is very late on, nudging it to leg
Short and quick from McGrath; Kemp gets into an almighty mess, hopping and skipping like a nervous rabbit but they scamper through for a single
classic McGrath, cutting this back into him and it's defended solidly
right in the channel there, absolutely perfect line just outside off stump and he comes forward, rather tentatively, defending it back to McGrath
and McGrath is in once again, chugging up to the crease and again lands it on a sixpenny and Gibbs is forced to block it out on the front foot
ever so slightly wider from McGrath - the teaser; the tempter - but Gibbs won't be teased or tempted and leaves it alone like a big winner
Gibbs again leaves it alone outside off
Another prehistoric grunt from Tait as he flings this down - but it's a little too straight and worked off his pads
outside off, Gibbs plants his foot and slashes it over the slips - not far off at all
ah, very good comeback from Tait just pitching it up a smidgen more; Gibbs, looking a little terrified in fact, is back in his crease and defending it without great conviction
oh hello, a Tait slower ball. That's new - or at least, I've not seen it much before. Gibbs reads it, though, and on the front foot neatly guides it down to third man with surprising deftness
oh dear, Tait's replaced his sniper rifle with the greater-spotted potato gun. This is miles down the leg side and Gilchrist doesn't have a chance
on off stump this time, much better, and it's firmly defended
cracking ball, at high pace, swinging into the right hander who digs it out at the very last moment. A yorker, in fact
and he starts lazily, drifting it down the leg side and Gibbs plucks it with ease to leg
ooh close! A lovely delivery angling across a very nervous Justin Kemp who, even more nervously, pushes forward without conviction and edges it past the second slip
defended on the front foot
ah, delightful shot, coming forward on the front foot and just working it - smudging it - through midwicket
gets into a bit of a tangle, Kemp, here. A shorter delivery which rises up on him and he defends, using his chest
this time he decides against using his rib cage, preferring the willow. He's forward, he's defending and he's roaring a loud "no"
what a magnificent shot from Gibbs, a flick behind square which beats the man at deep square leg
and Gibbs drives with vast amounts of class here, but straight to cover
much better from Watson - that's the length and it's pumped back to the bowler
just a little wider this time from Watson and Gibbs is back-and-across, pushing it out to cover
a Watson slower-ball which is nicely nudged off the front foot down to fine leg
Kemp is less deft, but he defends with a solid lunge of the front foot and pushes this back to the bowler
quick, on middle-and-leg and it's worked further to leg
again on leg stump - quick and flat - turned around the corner
well bowled, on middle stump and Kemp comes forward - massively - defending it on the front foot
that's more like it from Kemp, hammering it on the front foot and timing it very well but straight to cover
what a ball from the tongue-master, a wrong'un which Kemp complete misreads, coming forward, trying to defend, but missing it by a country mile
and again he's beaten
poor delivery, short and straight, Gibbs pulling it behind square
better; Gibbs is solid, defending it on the front foot
good idea from Watson, who increasingly resembles the incredible hulk, bouncing the batsman...but he's pretty settled now, ducking underneath it easily
pushed back to the bowler and Gibbs gives him a stare. And why not?
calmly strokes past short extra cover
on middle-and-off, Kemp lunges forward like a monster and defends
poor ball outside leg, deftly paddled around the corner
very well played again, straighter this time and he plants his foot down the pitch and ladles it around the corner
flicked through midwicket
blocked out on the front foot
"awwwww" cries Gilchrist, or Hogg - not sure who - as this quicker ball is blocked out on middle
a full bunger from Hogg, punched through cover - rather takes Kemp by surprise, hence not trying to hit it into the USA
defended on the front foot
excellent ball on off stump and he comes forward to defend this out to cover
ah, now then - that's more like it from Watson. An excellent bouncer which takes the batsman by surprise, as he attempts to pull before deciding to leave it well alone
Kemp late-cuts this with oodles of time, and class, behind point and wide of third man who sprints to his right to field
swinging into him, it's defended on the front foot
another good one just outside off. Watson bowling with excellent control so far and it's blocked out
on leg stump, picked off for a single
ooh, this one holds up on him - just outside off, spinning back into him and jumping up a touch, it's blocked out
full and straight, blocked out
and he plays and misses outside off - the arm ball there
on leg stump - flatter and quicker and defended
beaten! Terrific ball, the wrong'un which he plays at and misses, Hogg's tongue slavers around uncontrollably
on leg and that's skewed in front of square to the man there
slower ball, on the money, and that's defended forward
beautiful delivery that one, nipping back in at the righthander and threatening to kiss the outside edge
left alone this time

short and Kemp's on that one so quickly, fending the ball with a hook right off his helmet - top work, that was close to him, and although he didn't get hold of it properlyit sailed away. And that's the fifty partnership
defended off the back foot into the covers
on leg, the batsman comes forward and sweeps that round on the front foot behind square
swept that round behind square
the one that went the other way - the ball, not his tongue - and that slavers outside off and is left alone easily
another ball on leg, another sweep, this one dinked as gentle as the others
on middle, doesn't read that one, and a tentative prod from Kemp sends an outside edge backward of point
outside leg, chased round, and that's just to say wide
on leg and that turns towards leg even more, the batsman just poking that into short square
grunts that one in at the righthander, up there outside off, and that's driven into the covers with a bark of a "Wait!"
bouncer, straight and high. Tait follows through with a serious look on his face - he means more business here all right
outside off, way too much width and Gibbs just opens his shoulders and swings hard, and that one flies up off the base of the bat behind point, not quite where he intended it, but it fair raced away
pushes him back up there to defend into the covers

got him this time! A very, very thin edge - much thinner than the one which wasn't given earlier, also to Tait - looking for the short-pitched delivery. His feet were just rooted in the crease there as he chased the ball away from his body
good pace, right up there and scattering a cloud of dust as Hall edges that low, on the front foot, and unconvincingly down towards the slip region
right up there, that's defended down and they choose to "Wait!"
up there again, on middle, and that's defended once more, on the front foot again
pitches on middle, moves to off and Kemp's not sure how to play that - he tries to sweep, doesn't really get hold of the ball
defended again, Kemp not looking at all comfortable
wide down off, Kemp backs away to give himself room to cut, but that one went the other way and he was miles away from it
another wide down off. By George! Hogg can't believe that one - not sure why, it was very wide
defended this time
comes forward and defends that one on the front foot. Not much fuss about that shot
awkward bounce to deal with that one, but Hall stays cool as ever defending down off the back foot
gets his yorker line all wrong, and that's worked off the toes out to Mr Hussey-Cricket on the deep square boundary and he does a slide and relay with McGrath
left alone outside off this time
better yorker this time, obviously the length was right as before, but this time it was on the toes and that's just defended forward
bouncer down the channel and Kemp leaves that one alone
another bouncer, straight, and that's well avoided
tosses that one up, it dips naughtily at the last minute and the batsman rolls out a tame forward drive
right up there, defended and if Gilchrist is to be believed that was a "Nice one, Georgie"
swished off the toes to short midwicket
right up there and there's a play and a miss
some room outside off, the batsman waits and cuts that away into the covers with a mere tuck of a cut
turning away towards off again, this shot isn't so neat, an ugly chop down, yet again into the covers

and Tait strikes again! Hall looked to lash that off the back foot through cover, but his feet must have been dipped in the same tub of superglue as Gibbs's as he strikes at the ball away from the body and a thickish edge rips through. Gilchrist makes no mistake
oh, Pollock was lucky to survive there, this one nipping back in off the seam and Pollock doing his valiant best to give Gilchrist another catching opportunity - but failed to get hold of it
right up there and that's poked into the covers. A bit of shuffling from Hogg in his sunhat as he takes his time to throw down the stumps. It looked in, and replays quickly confirmed it was
bouncer crashes into Pollock's gloves at just-crouching height - Pollock did well to shield his body there, but he's not looking comfortable
plays that away from his body, poking it down to gully off the back foot
more grunting from Tait, and that's up there, defended just outside off and just in front of yorker length
he's over the wicket and that's defended forward first up
across the righthander again and that's defended into the covers
right up there, defended and Gilchrist thinks that's "Nice, that". He's not wrong
on middle and off, Pollock plays that into the covers in a very defensive manner
straight, a touch short, and defended easily enough on the back foot this time
outside off, Pollock tries to cut that off the back foot through point, but chops an inside edge down into the ground, safely enough
outside off and that's swished at off the back foot. Little foot movement, his turn to borrow the team glue
left alone outside off this time
on leg and that's tucked tidily round off the hips, very fine, through fine leg. Awful ball, got the treatment
outside off and the batsman stands there like he's on the piste and about to fence at it - in the end, he stops with his bat suspended in the "Bat up!" position of coaching days of yore
defended on the front foot
down leg and that's accurately called wide
slightly slower ball, up there, and that's defended down
on off and Pollock gets his body over that one, defending it forward
touch of room and Pollock waits for that, and cuts it away off the back foot through cover. Lovely shot, bringing up the hundred en route too, note you
on off and that's defended down off the back foot
awkward shot, checking his off-drive and that's chipped back to the bowler whose clasping fingers accept that fly-trap-style
ooh, Nel pops up a catch into the vacant short-leg area. He's such a tease
Hogg gets his revenge, Nel's got no idea what to do that with that and settles for poking a bat at it and it fizzes past his edge. Nel smiles, his tongue popping out, too
a touch of width, very unMcGrathian, and that's worked away to the off-side sweeper
poor Nel's a bit at sea here and there's more poking and missing
left alone outside off
outside off, short, and Nel gamely has a slash at that one off the back foot, looking to send it to Row Z over covers. It doesn't even make blade of grass A off the wicket, as he misses it completely
sent high over midwicket, it lands safe and McGrath's hands fly to his hip as if there should be fielders everywhere
stroked tamely, like patting a dog, off the back foot into the leg0side off the back foot
on leg and that's tucked without much power off the thighs and into square leg
more defence - Nel has no idea what's Gwyn on out there (OK, sorry)
outside off and that's swished at on the front knee, horrid shot, almost playing that beside himself
defends on the front foot
more defence and Nel's relieved that over's over
defended on the front foot
slower ball slinked through on a good length, outside off, and Kemp lashes at it, but under it away from his body
cuts in on a good length, and just outside off, and the batsman clamps down on that, desperately keeping the ball out
slower ball and that one just, just leaps over middle stick and there's another fresh-air swipe
a hint of room which is enough to be guided behind point and leave Nel exposed
right up there and, like a great exclusive, that's well dug out
defended this time
swept round behind square and out towards the boundary where the sweeper fulfils his job description
a heave
more defence
on the front foot and just kills the threat with a dead bat
defended forward
up there and that's defended into the covers
outside off, just a touch of width and that's a very good shot indeed, that one cut away off the back foot with a mere flick of the wrists
width again, but only a mere hint; it's still enough to be cut down off the back foot fine down to third man
on off, a touch short, and that's pulled round with a delightful pirouette behind square
nibbles in at the righthander, poked into the covers and they run a quick single
opens the face but can only run that one to gully
right up there, awkward to deal with, and Nel pokes that one down
comes forward, a deliberate yet clunky stride, and that's defended into the covers
outside off and that's cut down - the ball just died a touch on him, this pitch is pretty slow
oh, attempted flipper, and that's a big call from the Aussies, a better one from the umpires; that was sliding down off
defended forward
outside off, veering down, and that's tucked to point off the back foot
on a length outside off and that nips back in, defended down
Tait flies into bowl, that lovely rhythm ending in a muscly delivery as ever - but all that effort goes to waste as this one is wide down off
changed his angle of approach ever so slightly, that's right up there on the money but poked forward for a quick single; good running
too quick for Nel who, like a spotty boy in a disco, aims a desperate - and futile - lunge at that one
wide down off
outside off and that's poked into the ground at the last minute - Nel again not really dealing with the pace
outside off and that's driven off the back foot in front of point
up there, the usual grunt, on off, and that's defended into the covers
defended on the back foot
poked forward and there's a quick single
a quick would-be single into the midwicket region and Nel and Kemp both set off, then have to dive to make their ground. Nel finds the whole thing hilarious
dinked into the leg side
lowish full toss - thigh height - and Nel deals well with the approaching weapon, defending that down without much fuss
in the blockhole, but Nel doesn't block, rather he drives back to the bowler on the bounce, who snaps at it, gets his right hand on it and parries the ball into the ground
on leg and that's driven out to McGrath at mid-on
up there again, a yorker on off stick, and that's bumped into the ground
on leg, slower delivery, and that's prodded into mid-on
attempted bouncer, doesn't lift as much as he would expected, chest height nonetheless and that kicks through down the channel
swing there, and that's dug out into the covers
driven forward and that rounds off another stifling over
up there and driven forward, straight, without much power
speared in on leg, dinked into short cover, and there's a shy and a miss at the non-striker's end
low full toss, driven out to straight midwicket where Ponting does well to dive and take the pace off the ball with a left-hand grasp. It's tidied up further out
on leg, Nel tries to get bat on it, the umpire rules pad, and they shuffle a quick single
driven forward and there's another single
bouncer, and another single up ... and down to third man
short and wide, slashed high to backward point who backpeddled and took an easy catch above his head
slower ball - if you can describe 81mph as slower - and Langeveldt into line to block
faster and a bit shorter, Langeveldt sways out of the way. It probably would have missed him anyway
full, Langeveldt winds up and drives the ball to Hogg at mid-off
Tait loses his bearings and spears one down the leg side
full and this time on target, Kemp defends
quite deliberately and safely steered down to third man. Kemp keeps the strike
Watson attempts the yorker, doesn't quite get it right and Kemp slams a full toss back over the bowler's head
full, driven almost as hard but there is a long-off in place
Langeveldt heads towards the square-leg umpire and blocks
decent ball which Langeveldt swings at, hits, and the ball arcs short of the man out in the deep on the off side
another full toss from Watson which Kemp absolutely smears through extra cover
slower ball but Kemp can't find the single he needs, leaving Langeveldt exposed
Langeveldt drops into the leg side and runs. McGrath teapots that the No. 11 was allowed to get off strike first ball
Kemp sweeps, Bracken appeals thinking it missed the bat, but Bucknor disagrees
driven into the covers
punched square on the off side
Langeveldt misses with a swish to leg, strangled appeal as it again pitched outside the line
defended into the off side, a quiet over but at least Kemp keeps the strike
Kemp heaves over midwicket to Hayden in the deep, but they decide not to run
driven straight to Tait at long-on, it went high but right to him. he caught it , dropped it, juggled the rebound before ending up in a big heap with the ball next to him
a big heave and a big miss
another heave from Langeveldt who is heading towards square leg as he plays it, over point and over the rope
up in the block hole and Langeveldt, again giving himself room, is in no position to play it and is cleaned up

inn2.comm: on off stump, a good length and it's defended
just angling back into Gilchrist this time who rocks back, defends it to leg and tells Hayden to "wait there". Hayden does just that
a well-timed defensive push back to the bowler
Pollocks drifts this one down the leg side and Gilchrist nobbles it off his pads for a bye
short and wide, Hayden's eyes light up and he cracks it straight to short extra cover
Pollock roars for no apparent reason, probably just felt like it, and Hayden defends this off the back foot

oh and he's bowled him! A terrific ball, swinging very late into Gilchrist who was rather trapped on the crease - trying to work it to leg - and it squeezed through the gate, knocking out his middle stump
well he got a bit too excited there, Langeveldt. Short, wobbling down Ponting's leg side who attempted to pull before realising there was no need
and that'll be another wide this time outside the off stump. But no, Aleem Dar thinks about it but decides it's just within the limitations
again very wide and much too short from Langeveldt, allowing Ponting to crack it off the back foot into the covers
ah, there's the length; Ponting comes forward, almost walking into this forward defensive
a touch too short again but the line was straight, forcing Ponting to defend which he did with the straightest of bats
my word, that is a thing of majesty from Ponting. On his middle-and-leg stump, he walks into the most perfectly timed on-drive
Hayden is forward, taking a giant stride down the pitch, working it powerfully to mid-off
far too wide from Pollock who is very fortunate not to be clattered for at least four; Hayden cracked it powerfully off the back foot but straight to point
swinging into Hayden, a much better length this time and it's pushed to a short extra cover
just short of a length, Hayden cuts it to cover but again can't break the gap
well bowled. Angling across Hayden who immediately decides to leave it alone, shouldering arms. Six of those please, Pollock
and he finishes the over well, dead-eye straight and Hayden works it to leg but can't get a single

and he's dropped. Ponting pulls, with immense power, and Prince at short midwicket dives to his right to attempt to pull off one of the tournament's most brilliant catches...but can only get a fingertip to it. Such was the force if Ponting's stroke that it still went for four
cracked off the back foot to cover
good line, here, Ponting pushing it off the back foot
shot, Ponting, pulling this shorter delivery quite beautifully through midwicket - in front of square, too
ah, good comeback from Langeveldt, the former prison officer, forcing Ponting to defend on the front foot. That's the length
"nah mate," cries Ponting as he creams this straight to cover
exquisitely driven straight back past the bowler for four. No more need be said
cut to point; Hayden still can't get off the mark
oh but he's off the mark now. Hayden's had enough of this block-prod-block malarkey, picking up this half volley and dispatching it over midwicket for four. Not pretty, but very Hayden-esque
that's a terrific line from Pollock, on off stump and Ponting pushes it just past the bowler - immediately Ponting sets off for a run, and gets it, much to Pollock's disgust
a squirted, smudged yet purposeful inside edge to mid-on
good length just outside off and Hayden is resolute in defence
oh he's definitely had enough now, Hayden. A stroke of brute, ugly power, heaving it through midwicket, flat, for four
a touch too wide but a good length, Ponting defends off the back foot back to Kallis
too straight from Kallis, on Ponting's middle stump and he flicks his wrists to midwicket, setting off for a single before Hayden sends him back
another big stride down the pitch from Ponting, creaming it to cover. He looks in absurd touch
good length, just drawing Ponting forward - at good pace, too - and Ponting cracks it on the front foot, opening the face of the bat, to Gibbs at point
driven to extra cover
a textbook cover drive, but straight to mid-off
and it's defended off the back foot
banged in short, but it's down the leg side and Hayden works it down to fine-leg. Nel falls over in his follow-through, as he so often does
terrible ball, a massive wide which Ponting just leans into, stroking it through cover, bisecting mid-off and cover, and it races for four. Absolutely no chance of stopping that
ooh that's better from Nel, a tighter line which forces Ponting to defend...though it's padded away and they pick up a single
but it's too straight, Nel not able to adjust his line and Hayden clips a single to leg
driven to mid-off
good bounce from Kallis but, oh dear, it's very wide of the off stump and rightly wided by the not-so-wide umpire
ooh and a play-and-a-miss outside off - fuller this time from Kallis and Hayden  tries to late cut, but the ball kept a touch low
crunched on the front foot to cover
hammered! My word, he very nearly killed short extra cover. Andrew Hall the fielder there
grief, that is some shot from Hayden. No great foot movement, flicked on the up through mid-on for four. Extraordinary shot in fact
pushed to mid-off this time and he sets off for a single
worked to leg but no single on offer
defended on the front foot
just a touch wide, giving Hayden the room to free his arms and he strokes it to cover but Hall does magnificently to prevent the single. Or the two, three or indeed four
tighter line and a fuller length which Hayden back-cuts to point

on leg stump, Hayden leans on it and clips it through midwicket. But the man at deep midwicket makes a fumble, allowing them through for two. Hall is not pleased, and the stump mic picks up every word
wide of the off stump, left alone...but it's a wide
down on one knee, Ponting carves it to cover

got him! Terrific ball from Nel, yorking Ponting who tried to work it through midwicket, playing across the line - a poor stroke to a very fine ball, and Nel sets off on a Bravo-like aeroplane celebration lap of the wicket
swinging into Hayden who works it through midwicket
drifting down Clarke's leg side and he works it off his pads

absolutely magnificent shot. The power...just breathless. Perfectly reasonable ball; Hayden swings through the line like a monster, and even though it rattles off the non-striker's stumps, no one can stop that going for four. Ominous power
again monstrously struck but this time straight to mid-off
timed off the back foot to extra cover
Hayden pulls but, for once, can't get hold of it
shuffled through, bustling effort, but that's just left alone outside off - Clarke with all the time in the world (cue Louis Armstrong song music)
more leaving
a bit of wobble and no dobble as that one nips back in and that's defended forward
more leaving this time, that one outside off
nice shot to get off the mark, leaning into that one outside off on the front foot and Nel's furious with himself
outside off and that's just defended forward
over the wicket, by the way, that's poked into the covers for a quick single and there's a very close shy from ABCdEV... ooh. Overthrows result
dabbed out off the back foot out to deep point where it's winged back in without much fuss
left alone outside off
short, straight and that's defended down, Clarke calling for Hayden to "Wait on". Again, I can't see him doing that, either
hostile bouncer, Kallis finding some spring there with one which whistles past the grille. Good bouncing, there
a tamer one, this just floating down the channel and it's left alone easily
driven straight to long-off
outside off and Clarke launches into a cover-drive but he doesn't time it very well at all
left alone outside off
bustled through down the channel and Clarke leaves it alone again
outside off and Clarke drives that, again without total timing, to the covers
round the wicket and that's eased into the covers
just to say strays onto leg and that's tucked into square
outside leg, that would have been good to a righthander, but he's a lefty, of course, and that's pawed round through fine leg
a touch of width outside off, Hayden connects cleanly and cuts that to gully
quick single to mid-off
on leg and that's tucked forward with some excellent placement in front of midwicket - Hayden turned down the second
on off and Hayden fails to pull that cleanly in front of square - ah, an overstepped no-ball is signalled - and he rehearses the shot when he makes it to the non-striker's end
on leg, bounces up and that's tucked into short midwicket
left alone outside off
a touch of width outside off and that's cut to point
outside off, short, and Nel's really pleased with himself, jogging through and laughing like Muttley. Clarke goes to play and then drops his hands at the last minute
outside off again, driven to the covers and again it's all about waiting on
on off and that's driven to the covers
more of the off-side stuff, tidy, and that's defended down
up there, on off, and that's driven back out to mid-on
outside off, dragged down a touch, and that's poked off the back foot to the covers
outside off and Clarke shuffles over with his pleasingly straight bat which he presents to the ball
outside off and that's driven out to extra cover
on off and that's driven to short cover where it's picked up immediately
over the wicket, incidentally, and that's driven into the covers
on leg and that's tucked in front of square
on the money and that's driven to covers
on leg and that's a lovely shot from Clarke, timing that off his legs in front of midwicket
outside off, eased through the covers
driven forward and there's a nice little single
on leg and that's poked to short midwicket
comes from wide of the wicket, and round too, and that's defended forward
on the money, on off, and that's defended forward
right up there and that's driven straight
outside and that's thlocked out to the cover boundary with a caress of a nudge off the front foot
slower ball monstered through long-off with a two-bounce four - doesn't even hang around to see where the ball went. Nonchalant or what
straight batted off the back foot to mid-off
up there and that's defended forward
straight and played forward
right up there and that's driven to mid-off
driven through the covers and that's two more rubbed off the target
driven into the circle on the leg-side and that's thrown back in
outside off and that's driven through cover
driven to wide mid-on
driven to mid-off
outside off and driven to cover
outside off, down on one knee and that's driven to cover
slower ball, lovely shot, a languid punch through mid-off
tucked off the hips to square
straight and blocked, all very correct
driven to mid-on and a quick single, Pollock picks up and hurls the ball right into the ground in front of Boucher, the kind of return that you see regularly in club cricket (well, at Merrow you do)
hit back hard at Hall, on the half volley and he semi stops before ringing his hand in pain
blocked to mid-on about twice as hard as most people can drive it, Pollock stops
yorker which Hayden jams down on, still managing to squeeze the ball into the leg side
knee-high full toss, hit back to Hall who stick out his right hand and fields
very gentle loosener, pushed into the off side
drifts to leg and Clarke helps it on its way to long leg
prodded to mid-off
patted to extra cover
defended into the off
full toss hammered straight at mid-on. You can almost hear the purring in the commercial department at ICC Towers in Dubai
half volley push-driven to long-on
to describe this as pedestrian is an insult to pedestrians ... patted to long-off for variety
steered off the open face of the bat to point
driven to long-on
slightly shorter, Hayden drops at his feet and looks for a quick single, Clarke decides that would be too exciting and turns it down
clipped to deep midwicket where Nel is lurking, both batsmen push for two from the off and make it with ease
leg-side half volley, clipped off his toes and Pollock has to chug round from long leg to field
well bowled ... a yorker which Clarke dug out late
mistimed drive, aimed at mid-off and hit to mid-on
flicked to mid-on
firm drive back to Kemp, the ball bounces kindly to him at midriff height
leggish and Clarke sweetly whips that wide of midwicket and mid-on has to scoot round to field
slightly short, cut hard to point
outside off, Clarke looks to cut again, misses and Boucher whips the bails off
third time lucky, outside off and this time Clarke finds the space, running the ball down to third man
Hayden hits that one the up and dead straight, but he gets under it, Smith runs round a few yards from long-on and holds a steepler, but his knee buckles as he took the catch.
Clarke stands tall and smacks the ball off the back foot through extra cover
firm drive but no run as he fails to find the gap either side of mid-off
half volley driven to Smith at mid-on. Smith grimaces as he bends and switches to mid-off hoping the ball doesn't go there
back to the bowler, much to Smith's relief
driven straight back to the right of Hall, mid-on scampers round to field. had Smith been there, he would never have made it
Symonds back and pushes the ball to mid-on with a loud Brummie "wait"
Symonds back again, this time he flicks it square on the leg to get off the mark
Jenny purrs as Clarke eases the ball off his pads between mid-on and midwicket. All so easy, all so predictable
horrible long-hop which may have been an attempted bouncer from the snarling Nel, Symonds smacks it dismissively through midwicket. Fetch
carved through the off side, Nel stares and Symonds just trots past him without even giving him the time of day
slashed over gully this time
better ball, on target and blocked
outside off stump, Clarke leaves it
outside off at 86mph, Clarke hits it into the ground, it dribbles into the off and they run a single
pushed back straight as an arrow, mid-on again has to make a fair amount of ground to his left to field
Symonds half forward and drives hard to extra cover
whipped off middle to midwicket
dropped full and creamed back at Hall's midriff, technically a chance but it was really travelling and at this stage of the game, there's not much point in heroics
Symonds much more circumspect after the let-off
the restraint lasted one delivery ... outside off, smashed past extra cover and over the rope before you could say "what a rubbish ball"
driven into the ground and Nel takes at chest height in his follow through
chipped to mid-on, in the air but Nel would have needed to be Spiderman to have got across to that
wide and smeared to point where Gibbs makes a good stop diving to his right
into the ground, Clarke ponders the single but the ball went no more a yard in front of him and Nel was wise to what he was thinking
hit on the up, over mid-on and that's his fifty off 75 balls
checked drive, with a sniff of an inside edge, to mid-on
straight and Symonds very respectfully blocks
swished off middle to midwicket where Kallis makes a decent stop even though he overshot once he had got a hand to the ball
clipped off leg stump to deep backward square leg
Symonds heaves towards midwicket, get a thick edge and the ball scoots down to third man
pushed to extra cover
Clarke takes a couple of steps and drives to mid-on
controlled cut to third man
patted into the covers
yorker, Clarke digs it out with a little sniff of lateness
flicked to Pollock at mid-on, a quick call of "no" doesn't stop Pollock hurling the ball at the non striker's end
outside off, no contact
blocked to extra cover
worked through square leg
Clarke gives himself room and cracks that back from where it came, with interest
driven past extra cover, and a no-ball
leg-side full toss, Symonds does the business with a swish through midwicket and that's Australia into their fourth successive final
